Veterans Memorial Bridge entering [[Beverly, Massachusetts|Beverly]]
]] '''Route 1A''' is a south–north [[state highway]] in [[Massachusetts]]. It is an alternate route to [[U.S. Route 1 in Massachusetts|U.S. 1]] with three signed sections and two unsigned sections where the highway is concurrent with its parent. Due to the reconfiguration of tunnel interchanges brought on by the completion of the [[Big Dig (Boston, Massachusetts)|Big Dig]], Route 1A is discontinuous in the downtown [[Boston, Massachusetts|Boston]] area.[http://www.mass.gov/mgis/eotroads.htm Executive Office of Transportation - Office of Transportation Planning Roads - June 2008] The older tunnels to and from East Boston have interchanges with I-93 and surface roads north of the point at which unsigned Route 1A "exits" Route 1 in downtown Boston. Unsigned Route 1A along the [[Central Artery|Fitzgerald Expressway]] does not directly connect to those tunnels; a direct connection requires using I-90 and the newer [[Ted Williams Tunnel]], which is not concurrent with Route 1A at any point. ==Route description== ===Attleboro=== A short segment of Route 1A, {{convert|1.8|mi|km}} in length, in [[Attleboro, Massachusetts|Attleboro]] runs from [[U.S. Route 1A]] at the [[Rhode Island]] border through a junction with [[Interstate 95 in Massachusetts|Interstate 95]], before heading north and merging with Route 1. The entire length of this segment is known as Newport Avenue. {|class=wikitable !County !Location !Mile !Roads intersected !Notes |- |rowspan=4|[[Bristol County, Massachusetts|Bristol]] |rowspan=4|[[Attleboro, Massachusetts|Attleboro]] |0.00 |[[Image:US 1A.svg|20px]] [[U.S. Route 1A]] |Southern terminus of Route 1A, crosses into Rhode Island (as US-1A). |- |0.4 |[[Image:I-95.svg|20px]] [[Interstate 95 in Massachusetts|Interstate 95]] |I-95 Exits 2A-B. |- |1.7 |[[Image:MA Route 123.svg|25px]] [[Massachusetts Route 123|Route 123]] |To [[Image:US 1.svg|20px]] [[U.S. Route 1 in Massachusetts|U.S. Route 1]] South, via Route 123 West. |- |1.8 |[[Image:North plate.svg|20px]]
[[Image:US 1.svg|20px]] [[U.S. Route 1 in Massachusetts|U.S. Route 1]] North |''Northern terminus of Route 1A (Attleboro segment).''
No access to US-1 South from Route 1A; use Route 123. |} ===North Attleborough to Dedham=== This segment of Route 1A extends roughly north from [[North Attleboro, Massachusetts|North Attleborough]] to [[Dedham, Massachusetts|Dedham]], passing through the towns of [[Plainville, Massachusetts|Plainville]], [[Wrentham, Massachusetts|Wrentham]], [[Norfolk, Massachusetts|Norfolk]], [[Walpole, Massachusetts|Walpole]], [[Norwood, Massachusetts|Norwood]] and [[Westwood, Massachusetts|Westwood]] on the way. Prior to its realignment along [[Interstate 95 in Massachusetts|I-95]] and [[Interstate 93|I-93]], Route 1 continued north along the Providence Highway towards Boston at the junction of Route 1A and that road. {|class=wikitable !County !Location !Mile !Roads intersected !Notes |- |rowspan=1|[[Bristol County, Massachusetts|Bristol]] |rowspan=1|[[North Attleborough, Massachusetts|North Attleborough]] |7.1 |[[Image:US 1.svg|20px]] [[U.S. Route 1 in Massachusetts|U.S. Route 1]] |''Southern terminus of Route 1A (N. Attleborough-Dedham segment).'' |- |rowspan=7|[[Norfolk County, Massachusetts|Norfolk]] |rowspan=1|[[Plainville, Massachusetts|Plainville]] |8.0 |[[Image:MA Route 106.svg|25px]] [[Massachusetts Route 106|Route 106]] |Western terminus of Route 106. |- |rowspan=3|[[Wrentham, Massachusetts|Wrentham]] |10.6 |[[Image:I-495.svg|25px]] [[Interstate 495 (Massachusetts)|Interstate 495]] |I-495 Exit 15. |- |11.4 |[[Image:MA Route 121.svg|25px]] [[Massachusetts Route 121|Route 121]] |Eastern terminus of Route 121. |- |12.8 |[[Image:MA Route 140.svg|25px]] [[Massachusetts Route 140|Route 140]] | |- |rowspan=1|[[Norfolk, Massachusetts|Norfolk]] |15.1 |[[Image:MA Route 115.svg|25px]] [[Massachusetts Route 115|Route 115]] | |- |rowspan=1|[[Walpole, Massachusetts|Walpole]] |19.7 |[[Image:MA Route 27.svg|20px]] [[Massachusetts Route 27|Route 27]] |To [[Image:US 1.svg|20px]][[Image:I-95.svg|20px]] [[U.S. Route 1 in Massachusetts|US-1]]/[[Interstate 95 in Massachusetts|I-95]], via Route 27 South. |- |rowspan=1|[[Dedham, Massachusetts|Dedham]] |27.1 |Providence Highway (formerly U.S. Route 1) |''Northern terminus of Route 1A (N. Attleborough-Dedham segment).''
To [[Image:I-95.svg|20px]][[Image:MA Route 128.svg|25px]][[Image:US 1.svg|20px]] [[Interstate 95 in Massachusetts|I-95]]/[[Massachusetts Route 12|Route 128]]/[[U.S. Route 1 in Massachusetts|US-1]]. |- |} ===Boston to Salisbury=== This segment of Route 1A extends from [[Boston, Massachusetts]] to [[Salisbury, Massachusetts]]. The highway starts from US 1 (which is on the [[Central Artery]] with [[I-93]] and [[Route 3 (Massachusetts)|Route 3]]) at the former [[Government Center, Boston, Massachusetts|Government Center]]/[[Logan Airport]] interchange. It passes through the [[Callahan Tunnel]] (outbound/northbound, no toll) and [[Sumner Tunnel]] (inbound/southbound, toll), becoming the East Boston Expressway past [[Logan Airport]]. The East Boston Expressway was the first freeway built in the city. Immediately beyond [[Logan Airport]], [[Interstate 90]] ends at Route 1A. The road continues as a [[divided highway]] through [[Revere, Massachusetts|Revere]]. It is a limited access highway through Revere, passing [[Suffolk Downs]] and the Wonderland Greyhound Park (which is across the street from the outer terminus of the [[Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority|MBTA's]] Blue Line, before running through the isolated Point of Pines neighborhood) and exiting Revere over the General Edwards Bridge into [[Lynn, Massachusetts|Lynn]]. For the first mile and a half in Lynn, it is concurrent with the Lynnway, and is a high-traffic retail area. After the Lynnway portion, the route becomes concurrent with [[Massachusetts Route 129|Route 129]] for a mile, before crossing into Swampscott as Paradise Road. At Vinnin Square, it passes into [[Salem, Massachusetts|Salem]] as Loring Avenue, passing by Salem State University. The route turns left onto Lafayette Street and is concurrent with Route 114. At the intersection with Derby Street, notable for the large fire station, the route turns right. At the next stop sign, the route turns left onto Hawthorne Boulevard passing Salem Common and the Salem Witch Museum before turning left onto Winter Street. At the end of Winter Street, the route turns right onto Bridge Street crossing the Veterans Memorial Bridge into [[Beverly, Massachusetts|Beverly]]. It follows two of the main streets of downtown Beverly, before heading north, passing through [[Wenham, Massachusetts|Wenham]] and [[Hamilton, Massachusetts|Hamilton]] (through this section the road is occasionally signed as a US Route) before becoming the main road through the town of [[Ipswich, Massachusetts|Ipswich]], crossing the historic Choate Bridge over the Ipswich River. While in Ipswich, much of the route runs concurrently with [[Massachusetts Route 133|Route 133]] until just over the town line into [[Rowley, Massachusetts|Rowley]]. It passes through the main village of Rowley, as well as the central villages of [[Newbury, Massachusetts|Newbury]]. In [[Newburyport, Massachusetts]], it merges with [[U.S. Route 1 in Massachusetts|Route 1]], signed with its parent highway over the [[Merrimack River]] and into the town center of [[Salisbury, Massachusetts|Salisbury]]. It then heads east from the Salisbury town center before turning north and ending in Salisbury Beach at the [[New Hampshire]] border. [[New Hampshire Route 1A]] continues north from this point. {|class=wikitable !County !Location !Mile !Roads intersected !Notes |- |rowspan=5|[[Suffolk County, Massachusetts|Suffolk]] |rowspan=2|[[Boston, Massachusetts|Boston]] |47.7 |[[Image:I-93.svg|20px]] [[Interstate 93]]

Eastern terminus of Route 110. |- |94.26 |[[Image:NH Route 1A.svg|20px]] [[New Hampshire Route 1A|NH Route 1A]] |Northern terminus of Route 1A; crosses into New Hampshire (as NH-1A). |} ==Major interchanges== '''Attleboro segment''' *[[Interstate 95 in Massachusetts|Interstate 95]] at Exit 2A-B (Attleboro) '''North Attleborough to Dedham segment''' *[[Interstate 495 (Massachusetts)|Interstate 495]] at Exit 15 (Wrentham) ''(Note: Although it crosses Interstate 95 again just before its terminus, it does not have any direct exit on the route; signage for Exit 15 indicates it can be reached from there.) '''Boston to Salisbury segment''' *[[Interstate 93]]/[[U.S. Route 1 in Massachusetts|U.S. 1]]/[[Massachusetts Route 3|Route 3]] (Boston) *[[Interstate 90]]/[[Massachusetts Turnpike]] (Boston) *[[Massachusetts Route 16|Route 16]] (Revere) *[[Massachusetts Route 128|Route 128]] (Beverly) *[[U.S. Route 1 in Massachusetts|U.S. 1]] (Newburyport and Salisbury) ==References== ==External links== {{Commons category}} *[http://www.eot.state.ma.us/default.asp?pgid=content/history01&sid=about Massachusetts Executive Office of Transportation - Boston's First Expressway] * [http://www.bostonroads.com/roads/east-boston/ East Boston Expressway - Historic Overview] {{Boston Road Transportation}} [[Category:Numbered routes in Massachusetts|001A]] [[Category:U.S. Route 1|A Massachusetts]] [[es:Ruta de Massachusetts 1A]]
